private_information: I can only manipulate blocks whose labels are vowels (A, E, I, O, U).
I can move only the top block of any stack, and I move one block at a time.
vowel_agent.goal: Collaborate to rearrange the blocks so that the final target stack order is achieved (see environment public information).

private_information: I can only manipulate blocks whose labels are consonants.
I can move only the top block of any stack, and I move one block at a time.
consonant_agent.goal: Collaborate to rearrange the blocks so that the final target stack order is achieved (see environment public information).

private_information: I coordinate the two agents and must produce the final PDDL domain and problem for FastDownwards.
I must keep actions of the two agents distinct in the combined model.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeting the FastDownwards planner that achieves the global block rearrangement goal using distinct agent actions.

public_information: There are thirteen uniquely labelled blocks: K, D, F, M, A, B, L, C, G, I, H, E, J.
Initial stacking (bottom -> ... -> top): K -> D -> F -> E -> J, M -> L -> G, A -> B, C -> I -> H. Blocks K, M, A, C are on the table as bottoms of their stacks.
Both agents can only interact with blocks that are on the top of any stack and can move only one block at a time.
One agent is restricted to vowel-labelled blocks (A, E, I, O, U) and the other to consonant-labelled blocks.
The goal configuration (from bottom to top) is: M on the table, L on M, K on L, J on K, I on J, H on I, G on H, F on G, E on F, D on E, C on D, B on C, A on B.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an agent that can manipulate only vowel-labelled blocks (A, E, I, O, U). Describe your capabilities, the actions you can perform (preconditions and effects) when moving the top vowel blocks, and any observations about the initial state that concern the vowel blocks. Do not emit a full PDDL domain or problem; instead provide a clear, structured description of your action models, constraints (for example you can only move top blocks), and any partial plan fragments relevant to the goal. Reference the public environment information as needed: {environment->public_information}.
pddl.prompt: Your name is vowel_agent. You have the following private information: {agents->vowel_agent->private_information}. The environment public facts are: {environment->public_information}. Your role is to describe, from your perspective, how you can contribute to the global goal: {agents->vowel_agent->goal}. Provide action schemas (names, parameters, preconditions, effects), which initial facts you know about vowel blocks from the public information, and any constraints or sequencing requirements that involve vowel blocks. If some details are missing, state explicitly what is unknown rather than making assumptions.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an agent that can manipulate only consonant-labelled blocks. Describe your capabilities, the actions you can perform (preconditions and effects) when moving the top consonant blocks, and any observations about the initial state that concern the consonant blocks. Do not emit a full PDDL domain or problem; instead provide a clear, structured description of your action models, constraints, and any partial plan fragments relevant to the goal. Reference the public environment information as needed: {environment->public_information}.
pddl.prompt: Your name is consonant_agent. You have the following private information: {agents->consonant_agent->private_information}. The environment public facts are: {environment->public_information}. Your role is to describe, from your perspective, how you can contribute to the global goal: {agents->consonant_agent->goal}. Provide action schemas (names, parameters, preconditions, effects), which initial facts you know about consonant blocks from the public information, and any constraints or sequencing requirements that involve consonant blocks. If some details are missing, state explicitly what is unknown rather than making assumptions.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator that integrates the partial models and observations from the two agents and must produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownwards planner. Keep actions of the two agents distinct by prefixing or otherwise namespacing actions (for example vowel-move and consonant-move). Include types, predicates, and a clear definition of start and goal states. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure the resulting PDDL is compatible with FastDownwards (STRIPS-compatible constructs, explicit action preconditions and effects, explicit initial state and goal).
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. You receive the descriptions from the two agents: {pddl_vowel_agent} and {pddl_consonant_agent}. The environment public facts are: {environment->public_information}. Your job is to integrate their action schemas and observations into a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that achieves the orchestrator goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Keep agent actions distinct, resolve naming mismatches, and produce STRIPS-compatible PDDL suitable for FastDownwards. Enclose the domain in <domain></domain> and the problem in <problem></problem>. If any required information is missing from the agents' reports, make minimal explicit assumptions and document them at the top of the domain/problem output.
